question_sentence: Whose arrival caused 250 miles of traffic jams around Paris on Thursday morning?
evidence: The US president and First Lady Jill Biden touched down in Paris on Thursday morning on their way to the D-Day 80th anniversary commemorations in Normandy. Large portions of the city's Périphérique ring road were closed to accommodate the presidential convoy, bringing the capital to rush-hour standstill.

question_sentence: The US Food and Drug Administration rejected which drug to treat PTSD?
evidence: Despite recognising MDMA's potential, FDA panel members were concerned about research gaps and abuse risks, resulting in their 9-2 decision against approving the psychedelic drug for treating PTSD.

question_sentence: Elon Musk's Starlink satellite internet constellation is alleged to have impacted Indigenous people in which remote area?
evidence: Nine months after the region went online, Marubo elders have restricted internet access to mornings, evenings and Sundays, amid concerns that "lazy" youngsters prefer scrolling on their phones to hunting for sustenance. Find out more on this week's episode of The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: Which volcano this week erupted in Hawaii?
evidence: One of the world's most active volcanoes began erupting on Monday in a remote area of Volcanoes National Park that had not seen volcanic activity in half a century. The eruption paused after about 12 hours, but "activity in this region remains dynamic and could change quickly", said the Hawaii Department of Health.

question_sentence: Which country elected Claudia Sheinbaum as its first ever female president?
evidence: With almost all votes counted, 61-year-old former engineer Sheinbaum had an unassailable lead over her closest rival. She will officially take office at an inauguration on 1 October.

question_sentence: The CFO of which US right-wing news organisation was arrested this week and charged with money laundering?
evidence: Chief financial officer Weidong "Bill" Guan was charged with laundering approximately $67 million of illegally obtained funds and may face up to 30 years in prison for each of his three charges. The New York-based Epoch Times has since suspended Guan and will "fully cooperate" with the investigation.

question_sentence: Which fast-fashion giant is reportedly preparing to float on the London Stock Exchange?
evidence: The listing would purportedly value the Chinese retailer at around £51 billion. Labour and the Conservatives have both welcomed the prospect, despite Shein's controversial status as the king of disposable, mass-made clothing.

question_sentence: Prime MinisterNarendra Modi's BJP party won how many seats in India's latest elections?
evidence: Although Modi has secured a historic third term in power, his party lost its outright majority for the first time since coming to power a decade ago.After failing to pass the 272 parliamentary majority mark, the BJP is having to rely on coalition partners to return to power.

question_sentence: A new investigation revealed the extent of unauthorised pilgrimage tourism to which religious site?
evidence: As the annual Hajj pilgrimage approaches, tens of thousands of unauthorised pilgrims are laying low in Mecca hoping to join the rites. Religious Muslims are supposed to make the pilgrimage at least once in their lifetime, but Saudi authorities have imposed strict quotas and mandatory permits to reduce the risk of deadly crushes.

question_sentence: How many national titles has US gymnast Simone Biles won?
evidence: Simone Biles swept every individual event during the US Gymnastics Championships at Forth Worth, Texas, on Sunday, earning her ninth national title with an all-around score of 119.750. No other gymnast has won more than seven US national titles.

question_sentence: Which country elected its first woman president this week?
evidence: Claudia Sheinbaum won a landslide victory to become the first female president of Mexico and the first Jewish person in the role, adding to the growing list of accolades for the climate scientist and former mayor of Mexico City.

question_sentence: Which vaccine will likely be updated this fall?
evidence: A new version of the Covid-19 vaccine will probably be coming this fall after the FDA’s vaccine advisers voted unanimously in favor of updating the shot.

question_sentence: World War II veterans were honored on the 80th anniversary of D-Day this week. Where is the site of the famous landings?
evidence: Grand commemoration events were held in France this week to mark the 80th anniversary of the D-Day landings in Normandy. The Allied invasion in 1944 laid the foundations for defeating Nazi Germany.

question_sentence: Which social media platform did former President Donald Trump join this week?
evidence: Former President Donald Trump has joined TikTok — the social media platform with ties to China that he sought to ban as president.

question_sentence: Which city scrapped its plan to implement congestion pricing on busy streets?
evidence: New York Governor Kathy Hochul announced she is indefinitely delaying the implementation of congestion pricing in New York City just weeks before the plan was set to take effect. As part of the plan, some drivers would have paid $15 or more to enter parts of Manhattan.

question_sentence: Which weather event created dangerous conditions across the Western US this week?
evidence: A brutal heat dome is ramping up and sending temperatures to dangerous levels in California and the West. It is the region’s first significant heat wave of the year.

question_sentence: Which mobile phone network experienced an outage Tuesday that left customers without service for hours?
evidence: A nationwide AT&T outage temporarily prevented many customers from completing calls between carriers.

question_sentence: Which vegetable was recalled in more than a dozen states due to possible contamination with salmonella?
evidence: More than 160 people in the US have been sickened in a salmonella outbreak potentially linked to recalled cucumbers, according to the FDA.

question_sentence: Which two teams are facing off in the 2024 NBA Finals??
choices: Toronto Raptors vs. Golden State Warriors
evidence: The Boston Celtics and the Dallas Mavericks are battling for a chance to etch their names into the history books as 2024 NBA champions.

question_sentence: Boeing’s Starliner soared toward space in a historic mission this week. How many NASA astronauts were on board?
evidence: Boeing’s Starliner, carrying two NASA astronauts, safely docked with the International Space Station after the spacecraft encountered issues while en route. It marks only the sixth inaugural journey of a crewed spacecraft in US history.

question_sentence: What is the origin of the VIP program at The Starboard, a popular bar in Dewey Beach, Delaware?
choices: It was started by the current owner, Steve “Monty” Montgomery.
It was introduced to accommodate certain athletes and fraternities.
It was initiated to promote the bar’s shark mascot.

question_sentence: What is the significance of the Everett Theater in Middletown, Delaware, in relation to the movie “Dead Poets Society”?
choices: It was the location where the movie premiere took place.
It was the setting for a crucial 7-minute scene in the movie.
It was the location where the cast and crew stayed during filming.

question_sentence: According to the 2024 Leapfrog report, how did Delaware rank in terms of hospital patient safety in the United States?
In the 2024 DIAA Baseball Championship, which player from Salesianum scored a controversial three-run, inside-the-park home run that significantly contributed to their victory over Caesar Rodney?
What is the name of the new cartoon series written and produced by Aubrey Plaza for Amazon Prime Video?
Who is Hunter Biden currently married to and what is her profession?
What is the name of the inmate who claims he was targeted and unnecessarily pummeled by numerous Delaware prison officers after the prisoner uprising at Delaware’s largest prison?
What is unique about the mode of transportation of the Joro spider?
choices: It uses a process known as “ballooning” to fly from place to place.
It uses its legs to jump long distances.
It hitches a ride on larger animals.

question_sentence: Which of the following numbers has been retired by the Philadelphia Phillies in honor of a player who is not inducted into the Baseball Hall of Fame?
In 2024, how many years has the St. Anthony’s Italian Festival in Delaware been celebrated?
